definition: to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: Sharapova lost to Sam Stosur in her opening match on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 周二莎拉波娃在她的首场比赛中输给了萨姆斯托瑟。

sentences.english: Lippi overlooks last summer's Confederations Cup, in which his team lost to Egypt and Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 里皮回想去在联合会杯上他的队伍输给埃及和巴西后。

sentences.english: Although the stone inflammation does utmost, still had lost to Chen Fei.
sentences.chinese: 虽然石炎竭尽全力，仍是输给了陈飞。

sentences.english: Last game he had brought her out too soon and lost her to a trebuchet.
sentences.chinese: 上次游戏他太早放她出来结果把她输给了一个投石机。

sentences.english: We lost to a larger firm.
sentences.chinese: 我们输给了一家较大的公司。

sentences.english: He was taught by his father to never let non-humans get the better of him in life.
sentences.chinese: 他的父亲教导他，这辈子千万不要输给非人类种族。

sentences.english: John wants revenge for-losing the tennis match to Perry .
sentences.chinese: 约翰想要报打网球输给派瑞的仇。

sentences.english: He said the Chinese government had already been outmaneuvered by the Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 他说中国政府早已在谋略上输给日本。

sentences.english: I have spent my life vowed, I will work hard to not lose to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的生命发誓，我会努力，不输给任何人。

sentences.english: Europe is looking to recapture the Ryder Cup after falling to the US in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲队期望在2008年输给美国后重新夺回莱德杯。

sentences.english: It serves to show the strength of the Swedish team.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典队是怎么输给中国队的？

sentences.english: The defeat to Chievo was painful for how it came, let's hope it was a singular episode.
sentences.chinese: 输给切沃是痛苦的，希望这只是一个小插曲。

sentences.english: "Sandro is emerging as a top player," he said after Tuesday night's defeat at City.
sentences.chinese: 在周二输给曼城之后，他这样说。

sentences.english: South Korea's Cha Du-ri reacts after losing to Uruguay June 26.
sentences.chinese: 韩国的车斗里的反应后输给乌拉圭6月26日。

sentences.english: Mr Harris is as witty and cutting a writer as any.
sentences.chinese: 哈里斯先生的机智和尖刻不输给任何作者。

sentences.english: But Chick Hicks wasn't about to lose this race to a rookie.
sentences.chinese: 路霸可不想在比赛中输给一个新人。

definition: to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
